In a press release after being selected as the NSD ambassador, shooter Aya Magdi said “The National Sport Day represents a golden chance and new step to break the routine life through sport by meeting all friends and family members in a festive sport scene”.

NSD ambassador, Mansour Muftah said “Sports have changed my life and enabled me to learn the best human values, I belief that the NSD will inspire the nation (men, women, youth and kids) to gain physical fitness and create the new generation of starts for Qatar sport movement”.

EVENT SCHEDULE:\xa0http://www.sportday.qa/events

name: Next International CLC to be held in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
text:
The TAFISA Certified Leadership Courses in Sport for All were developed to train and qualify national Sport for All leaders around the globe.\xa0

Since their inception in 2007 and 2011 respectively, more than 30 International and National TAFISA CLCs have been successfully held all across the world, from Iran to Trinidad & Tobago, from Kazakhstan to Australia, from China to Tanzania, from Argentina to Latvia and beyond. \xa0With the support of the IOC for the development of the TAFISA CLCs from 2010, TAFISA has seen an encouraging rise in NOC hosts and participants alongside TAFISA member organizations.

The next International CLC to be held in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia between 4-10 May 2014 at\xa0IYC - International Youth Centre, Cheras, Kuala Lumpur.

Download documents:

Brochure | Invitation | Registration

learn more here

name: Congratulatory message on the occasion of SABA’s 30th anniversary
text:
On the occasion of SABA’s 30th Anniversary, President of ASFAA, Mr. Vong Iao Lek extends his congratulations with the following message:

“On behalf of ASFAA, I extend our heartiest congratulations to Sport for All Busan Association (SABA ) on the joyous occasion on its 30th anniversary.

SABA has been a member of ASFAA since 1991 and is widely appreciated for its commitment in the active promotion and exchange on the development of Sport for All.

I am confident that in the future SABA will continue playing its vital role and contributing to the positive development of Sport for All initiatives in the region. I wish SABA every success in its efforts to support our common pursuit of active living and healthy society, and I look forward to the opportunity to strengthen our relations and collaborations in the future.”

ASFAA President

Vong Iao Lek

Congratulatory message here

name: 36th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting
text: The 36th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting will be held in Macau on the 27th April 2014.

name: 1st TAFISA Martial Arts Games
text:
The First TAFISA Martial Arts Games will be held in\xa0Richmond, Canada, from September 4 till September 7 2014.

Learn more here.

name: 13th ASFAA Congress 2014
text:
The 13th ASFAA Congress will be held in Bali, Indonesia, from 9 till 13 October 2014.

Learn more here.

\xa0

name: World Walking Day
text: World Walking Day to be celebrated worldwide on October First.

name: 37th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting
text:
The 37th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting will be held in Bali, during the 13th ASFAA Congress 2014, on 10 October 2014.

Registration for the Congress\xa0is open. Learn more here.

\xa0

name: TAFISA Certified Leadership Course - Guam
text:
From 24th to 26th November 2014, Guam will lead the Pacific Region for the next international TAFISA CLC. Guam is a beautiful tropical isle in the western Pacific “Where America’s day begins.” Guam’s 212 square miles and 170,000 population make it the largest island in Micronesia. Guam’s average temperature is 75° – 88° F or 23° – 29° C. While its main languages are English and Chamorro (indigenous language), Guam has a very diverse cross-cultural populace.\xa0

Guam has beautiful white sand beaches, several golf courses, and significant historical sites from the Spanish era and from WWII. Guam has been a U.S. Territory since 1898. Guam’s currency is the U.S. dollar. Guam enters its own delegation in the Olympic Games.

The Guam CLC will be in the Westin Resort GUAM (105 Gun Beach in Tumon, Tel (671) 647-1020). The Westin Resort is an upscale 4-star hotel and spa, sits directly upon a beautiful stretch of beach ideal for water sports. The hotel has 7 onsite dining options, plus pools with pool bar. The Westin has excellent conference/training facilities and is within easy walking distance of excellent shopping, diverse restaurants, and entertainment.

More information here.

name: 22nd ASFAA General Assembly
text: The\xa022nd ASFAA General Assembly\xa0will be held in Bali, during the 13th ASFAA Congress 2014, on 10 October 2014.

name: Richmond Olympic Oval Welcomes the World Again
text:
Less Than a Week to Go to the 1st TAFISA World Martial Arts Games - September 4-7, 2014

RICHMOND, B.C. – In less than one week over 300 competitors from around the globe will compete in the 1st TAFISA World Martial Arts Games inside the Richmond Olympic Oval from September 4-7, 2014.

The competitive portion of the event runs September 5-7 and features martial arts ranging from the exotic – such as Xtreme, Musical, and Chinese Weapons Forms – to the action-packed grapple and point sparring forms. Athletes will compete to earn medals designed by 2010 Olympic Games medal designer Corrine Hunt.

Before the competition begins, however, the games will open with free public participation martial arts demonstrations from 1:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. on Thursday, September 4th. Demonstrations will include Taekwondo, Sambo, Hapkido, and Jiu-Jitsu. Here participants can learn the basics of each sport from trained Masters and try their hands at activities such as board breaking.

"The City of Richmond is delighted to host this prestigious international event," said Richmond Mayor Malcolm Brodie. "The Richmond Olympic Oval is a world-class venue and we look forward to watching some of the world's best compete and perform here in their chosen martial art.".

Spectators to the competitive events can expect lots of entertainment options, including a beer garden and barbeque open daily from 11:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., musical acts including ‘Jazz Trio’ and ‘Guilty Pleasure’, and a spectacular Plaza Party on September 6th where fans can eat dinner and then mingle with their favourite athletes.

name: Samsung 57th Festival of Sport to promote “Sport for All”
text:
Organized by the Sports Federation & Olympic Committee of Hong Kong, China (the Federation), subvented by Leisure and Cultural Services Department (LCSD), and with Samsung Electronics H.K. Co. Ltd. being the Title Sponsor, the Samsung 57th Festival of Sport (FOS) Opening Ceremony was successfully concluded on 2 March 2014 at the Queen Elizabeth Stadium, to kick off the annual mega sport event.

The Federation was honoured to have invited Mr. Timothy T. T. FOK, GBS, JP, President of the Federation, Mrs. Betty FUNG, JP, Director of Leisure & Cultural Services, LCSD, Mr. Lawrence CHOW, Chief Marketing Officer, Samsung Electronics H.K. Co. Ltd, Mr. Karl C. KWOK, MH, Chairman of the Samsung 57th FOS Organizing Committee, Miss Olivia CHAN Yeuk Oi, JP, Assistant Director (Leisure Services) of LCSD and Mr. PANG Chung, SBS, BBS, Hon. Secretary General of the Federation to officiate at the Ceremony. Ambassador of Samsung 57th Festival of Sport, Miss CHAN Hei Man Hayley Victoria (Windsurfing) demonstrated physical exercise and shared their enthusiasm in sports participation during the Ceremony, to promote the message of “Sport for All” to the public.\xa0

Other programmes at the Opening Ceremony included Dragon & Lion Dance, DanceSport and Roller Sports demonstration, March-in Band and Cheerleading performance etc. In addition, free Sports Trials were organized for the audiences to experience the joy of sports.

more here

name: Pink Fish: Learning Swimming Basics
text:
The Pink Fish is a course to teach swimming basics and is organized by the Swimming Center of Qatar Women Sport Committee.

The course will last for for four months, till June 30 and be held 3 days per week, from 2:30pm to 4:00pm in Al-Arabi Sports Club swimming pool.

learn more here

name: Aspire International 6:50 Race
text:
The 5km Loop around Aspire is a test event or challenge for those looking for "beyond the marathon" racing and training or just wanting to test themselves to go as far as they can (up to 50k) within a 6 hours window.

Starting at 6.00pm on March 6, 2014, the loop encompassed multiple drinks stations, web streaming at the lap point and the usual goodies from an event such as split times in the results, photo, finishers medal, t-shirts and post run refreshments.

learn more here

name: Al-Jaber unveils Mellouli Swimming Academy objectives
text:
Mr. Khaleel Ibraheem Al Jaber, the president of Qatar Swimming Association (QSA) announced that QSA is planning to make “Mellouli Swimming Academy” as international swimming sport facility to contribute positively in turning Qatari swimmers into \xa0international champions.

In press release to Qatar News Agency on Sunday, Mr. Al Jaber said: \xa0 it is great honor that the academy holds the name of Oussama Mellouli, Tunisian Olympic champion, who enjoys great support from fans and lovers here in State of Qatar.

“The QSA has great confidence that Melouli effort through the academy will educate, train and turn the children and young generation into world swimmers. As well as the Academy is open for all citizens and expatriates” said Al Jaber.

learn more here

name: Sports for Hope Foundation Awards Unveiled
text:
The annual celebration and 4th quarter 2013 presentation ceremony of the Sports for Hope Foundation (SFHF) Outstanding Junior Athlete Awards (OJAA) was held at the Hong Kong Sports Institute (HKSI). A total of 11 junior athletes were presented with awards in recognition of their outstanding performances between last October to December. In addition, winners of three honourable annual awards; the Most Outstanding Junior Athlete Award, the Most Promising Junior Athlete Award and the Most Supportive National Sports Association Award, were also revealed at the ceremony.

Organised by the HKSI and sponsored by the Sports for Hope Foundation from 2012, with support from the SF&OC and the HKSPA, the OJAA recognises the achievements of outstanding local junior athletes under the age of 19 on a quarterly basis. Each recipient is presented with a cash prize of HK$2,500, a voucher worth HK$2,500 and a certificate.

learn more here

name: Public Entities Sports Festival 2014
text:
The Public Entities Sports Festival 2014 will take place in May and July, with Soccer, Basketball, Table Tennis, Badminton, Squash, Tennis, Bowling, Swimming, Athletics and Dragon Boat Races.

The Public Entities Sports Festival started in 2003, aiming at improving team spirit and the creation of permanent sporting habits among public servants through participation in sports competitions.

learn more here

name: Macau Women Sport festival 2014
text:
The Women Sport Festival 2014 comes to an end after the “Seminar about anti-aging with sport practice”, held in March 22 at the Macau Fisherman’s Wharf and the sports events held in March 23.

The Festival was organized by Macau Sports Institute together with The Women’s General Association of Macau and women from different countries were invited by the organizers to participate in the activities.

learn more here

name: Singapore sees record-breaking mass Taiji
text:
A total of 3,818 people set a new record in the Singapore Book of Records on Sunday morning for the most number of people doing Taiji. \xa0They beat the previous record set in 2012, when some 2,500 people came together for Taiji.\xa0

Acting Minister for Culture, Community and Youth Lawrence Wong joined the event.\xa0

name: 2014 IOC World Conference on Prevention of Injury & Illness in Sport
text:
The IOC World Conference on Prevention of Injury and Illness in Sport will be held from 10 to 12 April 2014 at the Grimaldi Forum in Monte Carlo, Monaco. Bringing together team physicians and medical science and sports experts from across the world, the Conference will explore risk factors, mechanisms and effective prevention strategies to ensure that athletes remain fit and healthy in and out of competition. 

Using a multidisciplinary approach, the objective of the Conference is to transfer academic knowledge on injury - and illness-prevention strategies to the field of play in order to minimise the risk factors in sports participation and maximise safety for high-level and recreational athletes alike. \xa0

learn more here

name: Participants arrive in Berlin for 9th UNOSDP Youth Leadership Programme
text:
Moving on to the second Youth Leadership Programme (YLP) of 2014 , the United Nations Office on Sport for Development and Peace host their 9th successful event along with co-organisers Right To Play and funding partners the German Federal Ministry of Economic Cooperation and Development at Germany’s largest Olympic training centre.

This event focuses on the education of young community sport role models and brings together some of the world’s top development sport organisations to teach them transferable life skills. With thematic topics such as gender equality, sport for those with a disability, community development through sport, peace and conflict resolution being covered by the trained development facilitators.\xa0

learn more here

name: 36th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting successfully concluded in Macau
text:
The 36th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting successfully concluded in Macau, China on 27 April 2014. In the meeting, the Board of Directors approved the final date for the 13th ASFAA Congress 2014, which will be held on 9 -13 October 2014 in Bali, Indonesia.

The 36th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting, the first meeting of the Board for the year 2014, took place at the meeting room of the East Asian Games Dome in Macau, China on 27 April 2014. The meeting was attended by all the members of the ASFAA Board of Directors.\xa0

Group photo of ASFAA Board of Directors taken at the meeting

The key item on the agenda was the review of the programme of the upcoming 13th ASFAA Congress, which according to the decision approved at the 21st ASFAA Extraordinary General Assembly held last October in Enschede, the Netherlands, was allotted to Asiana Kungfu, Dragon, & Lion Dance (Dragon Boat) Federation and will be held in Bali, Indonesia.

In the meeting, the Board reviewed the programme presented by Dr. Nurdin Purnomo, Chairman of Asiana Kungfu, Dragon, & Lion Dance (Dragon Boat) Federation. After taking into careful consideration of the international sport calendar and local activities in Bali, the Board of Directors approved the final date of the Congress as 9 – 13 October 2014 and adopted the final theme “Designing To Move for Active Tourism” for the Congress with Grand Bali Beach Hotel and Spa \xa0selected as the official Congress venue.\xa0

36th ASFAA Board of Director Meeting held in Macau, China

The ASFAA Congress is an international event held biannually by ASFAA, which aims to bring together leaders and personnel involved in field of Sport for All, to exchange ideas and best practices in Sport for All related programmes and policies and serve to encourage the development and promotion of Sport for All movement.\xa0

The 13th ASFAA Congress with the theme “Designing To Move for Active Tourism” aims to explore the relationship and synergistic elements between recreation, sport and tourism. ASFAA invites all its members, stakeholders, friends and Sport for All enthusiasts from around the world to attend this global gathering.

During the visit in Macau, ASFAA Board of Directors were invited to attend the opening ceremony of 2014 Macao Sport for All Day for the Disabled

Further details on the 13th ASFAA Congress’ programme, theme and registration procedure will be released in the near future and will be available on ASFAA website.

So save the date in your calendar and stay tune to ASFAA website (www.asfaa.org) for more details about the Congress and other ASFAA events.

name: UN International day of Sport for Development and Peace Day
text:
As we celebrate the first UN Sport for Development and Peace Day, we also celebrate the Australian Sports Outreach Program (ASOP), whose work to date has shown that when quality sports programs are used strategically, they can make a positive difference in the lives of the most marginalised people.

The International Day of Sport for Development and Peace recognises sport as a genuine approach for developing and making communities stronger everywhere around the world.

Sport is a great way to manage the risk of chronic diseases by getting people more physically active more often and to help marginalised people develop life skills.

It also assists to improve participation in their local economy and to create more harmony within and between communities.

name: ICC WT20 finals a fitting celebration of United Nations Day of Sport for Development and Peace
text:
After three pulsating weeks of men’s and women’s international cricket played out in front of terrific crowds across Bangladesh, it is fitting that the finals of the ICC World Twenty20 Bangladesh 2014 should take place on the occasion of the first United Nations International Day of Sport for Development and Peace.

Throughout the ICC WT20 2014, the International Cricket Council (ICC) has partnered with UNAIDS and UNICEF to deliver the global awareness partnership THINK WISE, and worked with both Room to Read to promote literacy and WASH United to promote hygiene and good sanitation across Bangladesh.

Learn more here

name: Cambodia supports the 1st international day of sports for development and peace.
text:
As part of the Olympic Culture and Education Program, the National Olympic Committee of Cambodia (NOCC) is delighted to support the first ever International Day for Development and Peace, which is taking place on 6 April 2014.

NOCC Secretary General said “Sports is a philosophy of life and a Right for All”. Nothing could bring happiness to all than the to put down weapon and embrace sports either by running, jumping and throwing as fast and as far as we can or by kicking or throwing a ball.

Learn more here

name: Sport for Peace and Friendship Games
text:
In celebration of the United Nations' first annual International Day of Sport for Development and Peace, the Lao Rugby Federation is bringing together some local and international teams for a friendly competition.\xa0

The Hong Kong Vandals will be touring Laos, and visiting the LRF's own sport for development project in Nonghet, Xieng Khouang. \xa0They will hold a friendly inter-village youth rugby tournament between the 12 villages where Lao Rugby works.

The teams will play together to celebrate the potential for sport to positively bring together people of different ages, cultures, and backgrounds.

Lear more here

name: Khel Vikas celebrates International Day of Sport for Development and Peace
text:
To celebrate International Day of Sport for Development and Peace, Pro Sport Development planned a volleyball exhibition at Gram Vikas Kankia Academy in Odisha, India. Such a day was ideal for promoting the girls’ volleyball programme as well as emphasising that an active lifestyle is vital to improving all round fitness and battling non-communicable diseases.\xa0

Pro Sport Development were delighted with the event and hope that it will encourage more females to partake in Khel Vikas volleyball activities. These include community participation, coaching courses or future camps and team events at the four schools participating in the project.

Learn more here

name: Sports Help in Development of Society
text:
“With the United Nations recognising April 6 as the ‘International Day of Sports for Development and Peace’, sports has been elevated to the next level,” said P. Pugazhendi, director of Sports and Youth Affairs, Government of Kerala.

“Sports for health have been pitched before, but it also helps in development of the society and to break barriers between two countries and cultures and unite them,” Pugazhendi said, referring to the clashes between India and Pakistan in cricket and FC Barcelona and Real Madrid in football.\xa0

“Sports also help to teach lot of qualities needed for life such as trust, honesty, endurance, inspiration to push the limits and the ability to face failure,” he said, urging the over 600 children who lined up in front of him to take to outdoors to spend the holidays instead of staying indoors.

Learn more here

name: SOIna Celebrates the International Day of Sport for Development and Peace
text:
Special Olympics Indonesia (SOIna) joined the world in celebrating the first ever International Day of Sport for Development and Peace (IDSDP) in a fun way. SOIna invited students from some Junior High Schools to join the Youth Activation Summit and also the celebration of the International Day of Sport for Development and Peace.\xa0

Being young, being free spirited, all those youngsters were not seen tired after all the sportive and creative activities. Smiles were shown on their faces. It seemed hard to say good bye.

Learn more here

name: University of Tsukuba Sport for Development and Peace Workshop
text:
The Faculty of Health and Sport Sciences at University of Tsukuba in Japan will organize a workshop to celebrate the International Day of Sport for Development and Peace on April 6th.\xa0

This event will be a ground for sharing ideas and creativities among students and staffs, and a good start of the new master’s courses in International Development and Peace through Sport which will be starting this year at the university.

Learn more here

name: Seminar on UN Day of Sports for Development and Peace: When the children play, the world wins!
text:
To mark United Nations’ International Day of Sport for Development and Peace on April 6, students, young players, sports enthusiasts and development activist shared quality time to discuss ways to confront challenges facing today’s Pakistani youth.

Iqbal Jatoi presented an overview of Right to Plays’ movement in Pakistan. His teams are engaged in sports for development projects in over a dozen districts of KP and Sindh, while attending to some 170,000 children on a regular basis through structured play-based activities with educational outcomes.\xa0

Wilfried Lemke, UN Secretary General’s Special Adviser on Sport for Development and Peace for RTP Pakistan, said, “I challenge everyone to look for those with limited or no access to sport and try to remove the barriers that stand in the way of their participation”.Learn more here

name: 2014 Sport for All Day
text:
The Sport for All Day events took place on April 12th, at Praça do Tap Seac, receiving great support from the public in a welcoming atmosphere.

The organizers hope that by organizing the "Sport for All Day", public participation in regular sport and adherence to a healthy life style will improve.\xa0

"Sport for All Day" events will continue to be held monthly in public places, hoping to promote interest in and love of sports.\xa0

Learn more here (original content in Portuguese)

name: Generations For Peace celebrates first ever International Day of Sport for Development and Peace
text:
Celebrating the first IDSDP, Generations For Peace volunteers in fifteen countries led activities to demonstrate how sport can be used as a powerful tool to bridge gender, religious and ethnic divides in their communities.

Generations For Peace volunteers in Afghanistan, Azerbaijan, Bosnia and Herzegovina, the Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Georgia, Indonesia, Jordan, Kyrgyzstan, Lebanon, Nepal, Nigeria, Pakistan, Palestine, Uganda and Yemen joined the worldwide call to action.\xa0

HRH Prince Feisal Al Hussein, founder and chairman of Generations For Peace, emphasised the significance of IDSDP: “I was delighted when the UN General Assembly declared 6 April as the International Day of Sport for Development and Peace. This is an important day to engage children and youth in sport.

\xa0It helps promote and boost the work that our Generations For Peace volunteers around the world are carrying out each day and week to lead change in their own communities. They are using sport as a powerful entry point to engage with children and youth to raise awareness and help tackle local issues of conflict and violence, inequality and exclusion, and social development.”

Learn more here

name: 2014 Macao Sports Day for the Disabled
text:
The 2014 Macao Sports Day for the Disabled was successfully held on April 27th at the Olympic Sports Centre Stadium. Featuring nine recreational and sports activities booths and three physical assessment stations, the event attracted about 2,500 participants and allowed the disabled, their families and the public to share the joy of the sports together.

This year marks the 12th edition of the Macao Sports Day for the Disabled. Like every year, the disabled and their family members could also play an active role and exhibit their sports spirit of self-improvement. Through different types of sports and various recreational activities enabled the public and the disabled to enjoy together the fun of exercising and conducting physical fitness assessments.

Meanwhile, through the event, the organizers aim to promote the vision of Sport for All, under the slogan “Let’s Exercise for a Better Health” to the disabled and the public, along with the positive message of “a harmonious society, social integration of people with or without disabilities, life-long participation in sports”, \xa0which will arouse public awareness and understanding of the disabled and to motivate their active participation in social activities and joint contribution to the creation of a harmonious and healthy society. This year the outstanding local athlete Ms. Kuan Sok Mui from the artistic cycling team was specially invited and her presence served to both a support and encourage the disabled to actively participate in society and to face challenges with a positive attitude and spirit.\xa0

name: 2014 World Challenge Day in Macau
text:
Jointly organized by the Macau Sport Development Board and the Civic and Municipal Affairs Bureau, and co-organized by the Health Bureau, the 2014 World Challenge Day once again brought up good news with the total number of participants reaching 264,176, which is the highest record over the last 13 years and equivalent to 43% of the Macau’s population.

The 2014 World Challenge Day was hosted on the 28th May, drawing participation of all residents to conduct physical exercise for 15 consecutive minutes. According to information as provided by The Association For International Sports for All (TAFISA), this year’s competing city, Novi Sad of Serbia, reported that approximately 57,800 participants, which was 17% out of the population of 335,351, had completed the 15-minute exercise.

Due to the overwhelming response and strong support of citizens, Macau was declared as the winner of this year.Through the organization of the World Challenge Day, the organizers aim to promote the message of exercising for a better health and spirit to the public, to call for their long-term sport participation to motivate the residents to exercise continuously and enjoy the fun derived, as well as encouraging the public to actively participate, by bringing physical fitness to new heights.\xa0

The data from this year has reflected the fruitful achievement of Macau’s commitment on promoting “Sport for All”, with people from all sectors not only being aware of the benefits of exercising, but also in the pursuit of an energetic lifestyle, in making sports activities to be one of the leisure activities in their daily life.

Worldwide results available here

name: Registration opens for 13th ASFAA Congress 2014!
text:
As decided at the 21st ASFAA Extraordinary General Assembly in Enschede, the Netherlands, the 13th ASFAA Congress will place in Bali, Indonesia and hosted by Asiania Kungfu, Dragon & Lion Dance (Dragon Boat) Federation with the support of TAFISA and the Bali Government.

The date of the Congress is now finalized as 9 – 13 October with Grand Bali Beach Hotel & Spa, Sanur Beach, Bali chosen as the official hotel for the Congress.\xa0

The theme of this year Congress is “Designing to Move for Active Tourism”, which is ideally fitting for the host city as Bali is regarded as one of the more popular tourist destinations in the region. As reflected in the theme, the Congress aims to explore the synergistic relationship between Recreation, Sport and Tourism; and at the same time, recognizing the importance of the “Design to Move” initiative in its action agenda and objectives, the theme also ties in with the aim to encourage discussions on the followings:

  • Broader Understanding of Sports Tourism – Beyond the Big Events
  • Using Tourism to Create Early Positive Experiences in Sport for All and Physical Activity.
  • Sports Tourism – Designing for Success
  • Designing Sport for All Legacy and Major Sports Events
  • Marketing Sport for All Tourism
  • Spaces and Places – Designing a Sport for All friendly Environments for Tourists

    • Through the collaborative efforts of the organizing committee and ASFAA, together with the full support of TAFISA, we are proud to present a rich Congress programme with keynote addresses and paper presentations to be given by renowned scholars and speakers from all over the world. Moreover, it is also the aim of ASFAA to create a lively and interactive platform of exchange not only on the academic elements but also to share together the social and cultural traditions through the various social activities included. Please refer to the Congress website for full details of the programme.

    Registration is now open! Delay no further and reserve a place at the Congress by registration online via the Congress website or through the completion of the registration form and return to the Congress Secretariat. Please feel free to share this invitation with your colleagues and other interested people and organisations in your network. Registration details, participation fees and hotel information can be found on the Congress website.

    We look forward to welcoming you to the 13th ASFAA Congress 2014 in the beautiful Bali!

    Additional information:

    Contact: Ripka Widjaja, Congress Secretary\xa0

    Email address: asfaabali14@gmail.com

    Congress website: http://www.asfaacongressbali2014.com/

name: The World is walking in October
text: Next month the world is walking together for the 24th time already. And for the first time TAFISA World Walking Day 2014 will run for the whole month of October with flagship events taking place on the traditional first weekend of 4th and 5th October 2014.\r\nThe preparations are going well and more than 25 countries registered already with more than 300 walking events all around the world. Among the participating countries are India, Benin, Trinidad, Iceland, Russia, Japan, Israel and Hungary.\r\n

name: 22nd ASFAA General Assembly held in Bali, Indonesia
text:
The 22nd ASFAA General Assembly was successfully concluded on 10 October 2014 during the 13th ASFAA Congress in Bali, Indonesia and with the unanimous decision of the members present, Macau, China was chosen as the host city for the 14th ASFAA Congress in 2016.\xa0

In the General Assembly, the candidate host Macau Sport Development Board, represented by President, Mr. Jose Tavares presented to the ASFAA members the bid proposal to host the 14th ASFAA Congress in Macau, China. The proposed theme of the 2016 Congress is “Leisure Activities Promote Sport for All”, which was selected given the wealth of experience Macau Sport Development Board has in organizing sport for all related activities in leisure time and public holiday. The strong backing and support of the Macau SAR Government coupled with Macau’s extensive experience in organizing major event/conference, convenient transportation system, excellent meeting/exhibition facilities and infrastructures have made Macau Sport Development Board an ideal candidate to host the 14th ASFAA Congress.

Apart of the election of the host city of the 14th ASFAA Congress, the ASFAA General Assembly also endorsed the 2013 ASFAA reports and reviewed the working plan for the year 2014 and 2015.\xa0

Prior to the meeting of the General Assembly, the 37th ASFAA Board of Directors meeting was also held on the same day, during which the Board of Directors discussed future plans and strategies to promote the development of Sport for All in the Asia-Pacific Region.\xa0

name: The 1st TAFISA Regional TSG Centre opens in Amravati, India
text:
TAFISA is proud to announce the opening of its 1st Regional Traditional Sports and Games Centre in partnership with H.V.P. Mandal in Amravati, India. The Centre was formally launched in presence of TAFISA Vice-President Catherine Forde on the 5th of September 2014.\xa0

This TAFISA Regional TSG Centre, as an integral part of a comprehensive strategy TAFISA has set up to preserve and promote TSG from the World, will particularly focus on Indian and Asian cultures. The opening of the Centre was followed by a successful TAFISA International CLC and an International Seminar on Sport for All and Sports Tourism, hosted and organised by H.V.P. Mandal.

name: The 6TH TAFISA World Sport for All Games, Jakarta, Indonesia 2016
text:
The next TAFISA World Sport for All Games will take place in Jakarta, Indonesia, October 6th to 12th, 2016. The Games will be hosted by TAFISA’s Indonesian Member Organization Indonesia Sport for All Federation (FORMI) and the city of Jakarta.
The main theme of the Games will be "Unity in Diversity" and “Let’s Move, Be Active!”
The venue for the event will be “Ancol Jakarta Dreamland”, a popular fun park with entertainment facilities and accommodations in very close proximity.

name: The 13th ASFAA Congress in Bali, Indonesia
text:
The "13th ASFAA Congress" organized by ASFAA and hosted by Asiania Kungfu, Dragon & Lion Dance (Dragon Boat) Federation was successfully concluded on 13 October this year, in Bali, Indonesia.

Participants from over 15 countries and regions met from 9 to 13 October 2014 in Bali, Indonesia, for the 13th ASFAA Congress. Recognizing the importance and the rising trend of sport tourism; under the theme “Designating to Move for Active Tourism”, the Congress explored the synergetic and collaborative relationship between Recreation, Sport and Tourism and the positive impacts sport tourism have on the development and promotion of sport for all.

The Opening Ceremony was held on 10 October in the Agung Hall of the Congress official venue, Inna Grand Bali Beach Hotel and officiated by ASFAA President, Mr. Alex Vong Iao Lek; TAFISA special advisor and ASFAA Vice President, Hon. Brian Dixon; Congress Chairman, Dr. Nurdin Purnomo and Director of Bali Government Tourism Office, Mr. Agung Yuniartha.

The Ceremony opened with a traditional Balinese welcome dance and music performance followed by welcome address of the officiating guests of honour. In his opening remarks, ASFAA President, Mr. Alex Vong Iao Lek highlighted the importance of the role of policy makers in tackling the growing issues of inactive lifestyles and the associated health problems. The need to reinstall physical activity into people’s everyday life; to empower individuals to make healthy choices; to cultivate an active lifestyle at early age and to promote active ageing of citizens. \xa0President Vong added that organization like ASFAA has a crucial role to play in providing the necessary platform to bring together individuals, private and public institutions to work together, to encourage the exchange of information and experiences for the common pursuit to disseminate the health and social benefits brought by regular physical activity.\xa0

Traditional Balinese welcome dance performance at Opening Ceremony

Opening remarks by ASFAA President Mr. Alex Vong Iao Lek at Congress Opening

The Congress was officially declared opened with the striking of a gong by the officiating guests and concluded with a special address delivered by Ms. Bae Shillings, TAFISA Director of Programs and Business Development on the “Use of Sport Tourism to Create Early Positive Experiences in Sport for All & Physical Activity”, which set the tone of the engaging Congress days to come.

Declaration of opening of 13th ASFAA Congress by officiating guests\xa0

Special Address by Ms. Bae Shillings at the Opening Ceremony of 13th ASFAA Congress

Prior to the opening ceremony on 9 October, ASFAA Board of Directors, ASFAA members and congress participants were honoured to have an audience with the Governor of Bali Province, Indonesia, His Excellency Made Mangku Pastika at the welcome dinner hosted at the Governor’s official residence.\xa0

Exchange of souvenir between Governor of Bali H.E. Made Mangku Pastika and ASFAA President, Alex Vong Iao Lek at the welcome dinner

Welcome Dinner hosted by the Governor of Bali H.E. Made Mangku Pastika for the 13th ASFAA Congress participants

In the compact and informative 3-day Congress Program, participants discussed and shared experiences on the various aspects, strategies and initiatives of sport tourism, with the focus on the following sub themes:

•\tBroader Understanding of Sports Tourism – Beyond the Big Events

•\tUsing Tourism to Create Early Positive Experiences in Sport for All and Physical Activity.

•\tSports Tourism – Designing for Success

•\tDesigning Sport for All Legacy and Major Sports Events

•\tMarketing Sport for All Tourism

•\tSpaces and Places – Designing a Sport for All friendly Environments for Tourists

Through the Congress, participants were able to deepen their understanding of the intricate relationship between sport tourism and sport for all and physical activity as well as to learn about the experiences and sport tourism programs adopted in other countries and regions. Through lively discussion, the participants examined ways which sport tourism can be used to encourage participation in sport for all and physical activity.

Congress participants shared their ideas and experience through keynote addresses, paper presentations and panel discussions at the 13th ASFAA Congress in Bali, Indonesia

In line with the Congress theme as well as to encourage the exchange of culture and friendship, the Congress program was further enriched with a range of social activities including participation in the Nusa Dua Fiesta 2014, one of the largest annual festival of arts, culture, sports, music and exhibitions in Bali as well as participation in traditional sport games in the form of Dragon dance competition.

Social Programme: Sport Demonstrations (Taekwondo and Dragon Dance)

Social programme: Cultural performances (Traditional Balinese Music and Dance)

ASFAA was honoured to receive the presence and support of its founding President and TAFISA President Prof. Dr. Ju Ho Chang in Bali, who addressed the Congress participants at the closing of the Congress on 12 October.

Group Photo taken at closing of 13th ASFAA Congress with ASFAA Founding President and TAFISA President Prof. Dr. Ju Ho Chang.

ASFAA thanks the Congress host, Asiania Kungfu, Dragon & Lion Dance (Dragon Boat) Federation for their effort in the organization of the Congress and to the Government of Bali and TAFISA for given the event their full support. ASFAA is also extremely grateful to all participants and speakers that helped to make the 13th ASFAA Congress a great success.

The next edition of the ASFAA Congress will be held in 2016 in Macau, China and hosted by ASFAA member, Macau Sport Development Board of the Macau SAR Government.

name: TAFISA World Challenge Day
text:
The World Challenge Day (WCD) is a friendly international competition in Sport for All and physical activity where communities from around the world compete against each other to motivate as many people as possible be physically active for only 15 minutes on a single day.\xa0

Above all the event is a fun day that creates awareness and enthusiasm for fitness and active living in the participating communities.

Read more about the WCD programme here.

name: Message from the President
text:
On the eve of the Lunar New Year, I would like to wish everyone good health and prosperity in the year of the Goat.

2015 is a year for consolidation and for ASFAA to build on the experiences gained as we cast our eyes ahead to the 14th ASFAA Congress in 2016, which as decided in the 22nd ASFAA General Assembly will be hosted by Macau Sport Development Board in Macau, China.

As usual, the Sport for All calendar for 2015 is packed with events, courses and meetings. In the region, Macau will host the ASFAA Training Course for the 3rd time, following the great success of the last two Training Courses held in 2010 and 2012. The theme of the training course is “Sport for all and youth development”, with the aim to provide a structural and practical training to personnel involved or about to engage in the field of Sport for All.

Internationally, two of the highlights in 2015 are the 24th TAFISA World Congress in Budapest, Hungary and 16thIOC Sport for All Conference in Durban, South Africa.

The theme of the 24th TAFISA World Congress is “Sport for All – the Ultimate Legacy”, which is the first event of its kind to address the vitally important issue of legacy in sport, and to discuss ways to extend the sport legacy for the generations to come, how we lead by example, and to create a legacy that can create early positive experiences for children and to integrate physical activity into everyday life.

The 16th IOC Sport for All Conference is the leading international Sport for All Conference for exchanging ideas and experiences in the field of Sport for All. The Conference will be attended for hundreds of tops experts in the field of Sport for All, who will share their best practices on a wide range of activities that have proven successful in getting people of all ages and abilities to become active. The many discussions and initiatives that have come out of this event will help to shape the many sport strategies and policies around the world.

We all have a part to play in ensuring the pleasure and benefits of sport are accessible to all and to promote equality in sport as well as to preserve the culture and development of traditional sports.

ASFAA encourages its members to make the most of the network of communication as well as the cooperation opportunities available among the members and together continue with our effort to develop and promote the Sport for All movement in Asia and Oceania and beyond.

Through participation in the various Sport for All programmes in the region and internationally, ASFAA will learn and draw from the experiences and to work together with all the members to develop successful sport for all programmes that can lead to healthier individuals, a strong society and a sustainable Sport for All movement.

Message from Alex, Vong Iao Lek

President, ASFAA

name: 24th TAFISA World Congress
text: The\xa024th TAFISA World Congress will be held in\xa0Budapest, Hungary, from\xa014 till 18 October 2015.

name: TAFISA World Walking Day
text:
On the first weekend in October every year since 1991, millions of participants around the world have taken to the streets to share in TAFISA World Walking Day. \xa0

World Walking Day is intended to encourage integrating physical activity into everyday lives.

name: Registration now opens for 3rd ASFAA Training Course
text:
ASFAA is pleased to announce and to invite you to the 3rd ASFAA Training Course, which will be held at the ASFAA Training Centre in Macao, China between 23 and 27 May, with the theme Sport for All and Youth Development.

Following the success of the previous two editions and with the continued support of the Macao SAR Government, the 3rd ASFAA Training Course will once again be organized by the Macao Sport Development Board. The aim is to provide a structural and practical training to personnel involved or about to engage in the field of Sport for All. It is also a valuable platform for exchange of knowledge and experience and to develop the communication network among ASFAA members, NGO and local sport for all institutions. \xa0Successful participants will receive an official ASFAA Certificate of Completion.

Registration is now open! Please refer to the attached information for further details on registration and fees. Deadline for registration is 24 April 2015 and will be accepted on a first come, first served basis.\xa0

name: Samsung 58th Festival of Sport officially kicked off
text:
Samsung 58th Festival of Sport (FOS) Opening Ceremony was successfully concluded today (7 March) at Olympian City 2, to kick off the annual “Sport for All” event.\xa0

Samsung 58th FOS is organized by the Sports Federation & Olympic Committee of Hong Kong, China (Federation), subvented by Leisure and Cultural Services Department (LCSD), and with Samsung Electronics H.K. Company, Limited being the Title Sponsor for the second consecutive year. The Ceremony was officiated by Mr. Timothy FOK, GBS, JP, President of the Federation, Ms. Michelle LI, JP, Director of Leisure & Cultural Services, Mr. Lawrence CHOW, Chief Marketing Officer, Samsung Electronics H.K. Company, Limited, Mr. Karl KWOK, MH, Chairman of the Samsung 58th FOS Organizing Committee, Mr. Raymond FAN, JP, Deputy Director (Leisure Services)/ LCSD, and Mr. Ronnie WONG, JP, Hon. Secretary General of the Federation. \xa0Ambassadors of Samsung 58th FOS, Mr. LAI Chun Ho (Athletic), Mr. WU Siu Hong, MH (Bowling), Mr. Max LEE Ho Yin (Squash) and Miss Stephanie AU Hoi Shun (Swimming) demonstrated physical exercise and shared their enthusiasm in sports participation during the Ceremony, to promote the message of “Sport for All” to the public.\xa0

Learn more here.

text:
ASFAA is proud to announce the publication of Volume 13 of the Journal of Asiania Sport for All (JASFA)! JASFA aims to bring to the reader latest research, discussions and reports on the trend and development of Sport for All in the Asia and Oceania regions.

We would like to express our appreciation to the authors who have contributed to the Journal and to thank the editorial board for their hard work.

name: World Challenge Day in Macao
text:
The TAFISA World Challenge Day was successfully held in Macao under the organization of the Macao Sport Development Board and the Macau Health Bureau Service, and attracted the participation of over 256,000 participants.\xa0

The TAFISA World Challenge Day is a friendly international competition in Sport for All and physical activity where communities of similar sizes from around the world compete against each other to motivate as many people as possible be physically active for only 15 minutes on a single day. \xa0

This is the 15th consecutive year that Macao has taken part in the Challenge Day. The event has received great support from the public and was joined by government departments, private organizations, local businesses and schools. This year, a total of 256,057 participants registered their successful attempts in performing 15 minutes physical exercise on the day, which accounted for 40.26% of the population. With this impressive level of participation, Macao has once again won the World Challenge Day Cup in its category.\xa0

The event is a fun day that creates awareness and enthusiasm for fitness and active living in the participating communities.The Organizers hope that through the World Challenge Day, to convey and to appeal to the residents the enjoyment of sport and to raise awareness about the benefits of physical activity.

name: 3rd ASFAA Sport For All Training Course
text:
The 3rd \xa0ASFAA Sport For All Training Course successfully held in Macao, China

The 3rd\xa0ASFAA Sport for All Training Course\xa0(Training Course)\xa0was\xa0successfully\xa0held between 24 and 26 May\xa02015at the dedicated ASFAA Training Centre in Macao, China. The Training Course was\xa0attended by\xa070\xa0participants\xa0from\xa0China, Indonesia, Iran, Korea, Chinese Taipei, Hong Kong and Macau.

The aim of the Training Course was to provide\xa0a structural and practical training to personnel involved or about to engage in the field of Sport for All.\xa0The theme\xa0of this year’s Training\xa0Course\xa0was\xa0“Sport for All and Youth Development”.\xa0Interactive\xa0and informative training sessions were\xa0delivered by\xa0experts\xa0from academic\xa0institutes\xa0and sport\xa0for all organisations from\xa0China, Australia, Great Britain, Hong Kong, Japan and\xa0Portugal. For details of the topics presented, please refer to the appended programme.\xa0

During their stay in Macao, the participants were also given the\xa0opportunity\xa0to explore the cultural heritage of Macao\xa0on an excursion to the\xa0UNESCO\xa0World Heritage sites of Macao,organized\xa0as part of the social programme.\xa0

The 3rd\xa0ASFAA Sport for All Training Course concluded with a gala dinner\xa0held\xa0at the\xa0Galaxy Macau\xa0on 26 May, during which certificate of participation was present to all the participants who have successfully completed the 3-day Training Course.

Through the training course, the\xa0participants\xa0were able to enhance their understanding of the Sport for All movement, the challenges faced and to draw on the experiences\xa0and ideas of the speakers and each other to develop and implement sport for all related programme in their own country and region.\xa0\xa0

ASFAA would like to convey our appreciation to Macao\xa0Sport Development Board for its wonderful organization of the event and to the Macao SAR Government for its unrelenting support to the development and promotion of Sport for All in the region.

name: 38th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting successfully concluded
text:
The 38th\xa0ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting successfully concluded in Macao, China on 23\xa0May\xa02015.

Under the leadership of President Mr. Alex Vong, the first meeting of the ASFAA Board of Directors for the year 2015 was successfully held on 23 May at the Macao East Asian Games Dome in Macao China.

ASFAA was honoured to have the presence and support of TAFISA President and ASFAA Honorary President Dr. JuHo Chang and TAFISA Secretary General Mr. Wolfang Baumann at the meeting. Major conclusions were reached at the meeting to further strengthen the ties and partnership between ASFAA and TAFISA.During the meeting, the Board of Directors approved the reports of the year 2014 and the plan and budget for the year 2015. Updates on the preparation of the 14th ASFAA Congress to be held in 2016 in Macao, China, were given by the President of Macao Sport Development Board, Mr. Jose Tavares at the meeting.

In addition, a delegation from TAFISA 6th World Sport for All Games, led by Mr. Faisal Abdullah, deputy minister of the Indonesian ministry of youth and sports and Mr. Hayono Isman, the President of FORMI also participated in the meeting and gave an overview on the progress of the Games, which will be held between 6-12 October in Jakarta, Indonesia. \xa0

The next ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting will be held during the 24th TAFISA World Congress, which will take place in Hungary Budapest between 14-18 October 2015.\xa0

name: ASFAA Board of Director approves the date of the 14th ASFAA Congress
text:
The 39th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting successfully concluded on 14 October 2015 during the 23rd TAFISA Congress in Budapest, Hungary. During the meeting, the date of the 14th ASFAA Congress was confirmed and will take place between 11 and 15 May 2016.

The 39th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting was the second gathering of the Board of Directors, following the last meeting held in Macau in May this year. The meeting was led by Mr. Alex Vong, ASFAA President and attended by all members of the Board of Directors. Guests of honour at the meeting included ASFAA honorary president and TAFISA President Dr. JuHo Chang; \xa0ASFAA honorary president Mr. Feng Jianzhong and former TAFISA President Dr. Kang Too Lee.\xa0

At the meeting, the Board of Directors shared and discussed the development of the Sport for All movement in the region; one of the main items discussed was the preparation of the 14th ASFAA Congress in 2016.\xa0

The 14th ASFAA Congress was awarded to Macau Sport Development Board (MSDB) during the 22nd ASFAA General Assembly held in Bali, Indonesia in 2014. Representative from MSDB was invited to present the latest update and progress on the 14th ASFAA Congress at the meeting. The final date of the 14th ASFAA Congress was confirmed and approved by the ASFAA Board of Directors and will be held on 11 – 15 May 2016 with the theme "Leisure activities promote sport for all". An official website of the Congress http://asfaacongress2016.sport.gov.mo will be launched on 11 November 2015 to provide further details on the Congress programme and registration.\xa0

Recognised as one of the most important events of ASFAA; the ASFAA Congress serves as a valuable platform of exchange for the ASFAA members as well as sport for all organizations in the region. \xa0To help to promote the event, promotional leaflet on the 14th ASFAA Congress was distributed to participants of the 23rd TAFISA Congress as well as to the TAFISA members at the General Assembly.\xa0

name: ASFAA participated in Sport for All Forum in Nanning, China
text:
The 3rd Asiania Sport for All cooperation and Development Forum & China-ASEAN Sport for All Cooperation and Development Forum was successfully held at the Guangxi University for Nationalities in Nanning, China on 24 November 2015.

ASFAA Honorary President Mr. Feng Jianzhong opens the Forum

The Forum supported by the General Administration of Sport of China, the People's Government of Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region and Asiania Sport for All Association (ASFAA), has since its inauguration in 2011 served a valuable platform for the exchanges and cooperation on sports for all in the Asia-Pacific region and in particular, in China and ASEAN countries.

This year, the Forum with the theme of "Sport for All and its Development in Community" was opened by Mr. Feng Jianzhong, ASFAA Honorary President and Deputy Director of the State Sports General Administration, and Ms. Lee Kang, Regional Vice Chairman of Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region Party Committee. ASFAA Board of Directors who were amongst the invited guests were represented by Secretary General, Mr. Hagay Herzel and Board of Directors, Prof. Yasuo Yamaguchi and Mr. Min Soo Kim; all of whom also contributed to the Forum as guest speakers. In addition, ASFAA Treasurer Mr. Liu Guoyong also participated in the Forum in his capacity as Director General of Sport for All Department of State Sport General Administration of China.

ASFAA Secretary General Mr. Hagay Herzel presents to the Forum delegates

The Forum attracted the participation over 160 sport for all personnel including experts and leaders from neighbouring ASEAN countries including Cambodia Lao People’s Democratic Republic, Indonesia, Myanmar, Thailand and Vietnam as well as local experts from all over China. Through in-depth discussions on topics focusing on the characteristics of sports for all and community development, outlook and promotion in international cooperation; the Forum has successfully enhanced the understanding of status quo of sport for all development in the region, expanded exchange and cooperation as well as strengthened the friendship between ASFAA, China and ASEAN countries.\xa0

ASFAA would like to extend our appreciation to Guangxi Sports Administration and Guangxi University for Nationalities for their dedication and effort in the organization of the Forum; and to our long-term partners the General Administration of Sport of China and the People's Government of Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region for their continuous support and contribution to the promotion and development of Sport for All Movement in the region.

name: Election of the new ASFAA Board of Directors
text:
New ASFAA Board of Directors: (Centre then from left to right): New ASFAA President PUN Weng Kun; Board of Directors WONG Po Kee, Ali MAJDARA, Sarjit SINGH, Hagay HERZEL, Yasuo YAMAGUCHI, Minsoo KIM, Brian DIXON and LIU Guoyong.

On the occasion of the 14th ASFAA Congress in Macao, China, the 23rd ASFAA General Assembly was held on the afternoon on 12 May 2016 at Sheraton Macao during which the new ASFAA Board of Directors were successfully elected and comprised of the following members:

President: PUN Weng Kun (Macao, China)

  • ASFAA Board of Directors:
  • Sarjit SINGH (Malaysia)
  • Brian DIXON (Australia)
  • Hagay HERZEL (Israel)
  • LIU Guoyong (China)
  • Ali MAJDARA (Iran)
  • Yasuo YAMAGUCHI (Japan)
  • Minsoo KIM (Korea)
  • WONG Po Kee (Hong Kong, China)

In the 41st ASFAA Board of Directors meeting held following the General Assembly, the office executives were chosen:

  • Vice Presidents: Sarjit SINGH and Brian DIXON\xa0
  • Secretary General: Hagay HERZEL
  • Treasurer: \xa0LIU Guoyong

The newly elected ASFAA President Mr. Pun Weng Kun, successor of previous ASFAA President \xa0Vong Iao Lek, is the President of Sports Bureau of Macao SAR Government. Macao has been strong advocate to the global and regional sport for all movement and each year under the support and directives of the Macao SAR Government has organised a wide range of sport for all events which include:

  • World Walking Day Fun Run and Hiking
  • Macao Sports Games
  • Macao Elderly Sports Day
  • Macao Family Sports Day
  • Macao Women Sports Festival
  • Macao Sports Day for the Disabled
  • Free Sports Ground” Ball Games Competition
  • Public Entities Sport Festival
  • A wide range of Sport for All Activities Classes

name: 14th ASFAA Congress successfully held in Macao, China
text:
The "14th ASFAA Congress" organized by ASFAA and hosted by Sports Bureau of the Macao SAR Government was successfully concluded on 14 May this year, in Macao, China.

Participants from over 10 countries and regions met from 12 to 14 May 2016 in Macao, China, for the 14th ASFAA Congress under the theme “Leisure Activities Promote Sport for All’’. The Opening Ceremony was held on the morning of 12 May in the Sheraton Grand Macao Hotel, the Congress official venue, and officiated by ASFAA President, Mr. Alex Vong Iao Lek; TAFISA President Dr. Ju Ho Chang, ASFAA Honorary President Mr. Feng Jianzhong as well as the Secretary of Social Affairs and Culture Dr. Alexis Tam and, President of Macao Sports Bureau, Mr. Pun Weng Kun.

Photo 1: Officiating guests at the ribbon cutting ceremony during the Opening of the 14th ASFAA Congress (from left to right: VONG Iao Lek, FENG Jianzhong, Alexis TAM, Juho CHANG and PUN Weng Kun).

Photo 2: Congress participates at the 14th ASFAA Congress

The ASFAA Congress which is held biennially aims to encourage the exchange of best practices and experiences among the participants; to explore innovative ways to effectively build physical activities into our daily leisure time and to promote an environment where sport is easily assessable for all. Leading sport for all experts from all over the world were invited to share experiences on various aspects, strategies and initiatives of sport for all, with the focus on the following topics:

Theme Address “Leisure Activities Promote Sport for All” by Dra. Maria Helena Santa Clara Pombo Rodrigues (University of Lisbon)

Topic：Social Function of Sports for All by Professor Ren Hai (Beijing Sport University)

Topic: Sport for All and right nutrition with healthy lifestyle by Mrs. Rakefet Arieli (Israeli Sport for All Association)

Topic : Achieving Wellness for the Elderly Population by Professor Frank Fu (Hong Kong Baptist University)

Topic : A Comparative Cross-national Study of Policies and Training Centres for\xa0 Paraolympics by Professor Yasuo Yamaguchi (Kobe University )

Photo 3: Experience shared by sport for all expert during the Congress

In line with the Congress theme as well as to encourage the exchange of culture and friendship, the Congress program was further enriched with a range of social activities including a tour of Macao famous UNESCO World Heritage sites as well as participation in the 2nd Macao Sports Games which is a local large-scale annual sport for all event organised by the Macao Sports Bureau for the public.

Photo 4: Congress participants taking in the historical sights of Macao during the World Heritage Tour

Photo 5: Joining in at local sports event - the 2nd Macao Sports Games

name: The ASFAA Family Mourns Prof. Anita Ghosh
text:
Prof Anita Ghosh, former board member of ASFAA, passed away with her sincere devotion and contribution remained with us. \xa0

She was also the president of All India Association of Sport for All, follower of TAFISA and a pioneer of sport for all in India. She put great effort into promoting Sports for All during her life time, announced valuable researches and made speeches in international congresses.\xa0

We are not only grieved at the passing of a tremendous individual but also for the loss in the field of sport for all. Our thoughts are with her family at this sad time.

name: 42nd ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting
text:
The 42 nd ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting successfully concluded in Macao, China on 18 January 2017. Chaired by the President of ASFAA, Mr. Pun Weng Kun, the meeting discussed the activities and development plans of Sport for All in the Asian and Oceania region with board of directors from Australia, Malaysia, Israel, China, Iran, Japan, Korea and Hong Kong, China.

Group photo of ASFAA Board of Directors taken at the meeting

A number of reports were approved during the 42nd ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting, and issues for future development of the Association were also discussed. Members shared valuable experiences in their respective countries and regions, bringing in productive plans and exchanged views for the development of Sport for All in the Asian and Oceania region. During their stay, members also participated in the annual “Award Ceremony of Bonuses and Certificates of Merit in Sports to Outstanding Athletes and Coaches”, and outdoor leisure activities, offering them another opportunity to know more about the development of sport in Macao.

42nd ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting held in Macao, China

ASFAA is a non-profit organization that promotes sustainable development of Sport for All in Asian and Oceania region and its purpose is, through the cooperation of organizations and members, to strengthen the promotion of the development and exchange of Sport for All in the regions. To better support the growth of Sport for All, the ASFAA Training Center was officially established in 2010 which serves to be a solid base for training activities and a important platform for the exchange of knowledge and experiences. In 2016, the Sports Bureau hosted the 14th ASFAA Congress and invited experts and academics from all over the world to provide participants with up-to-date information on the development of Sport for All.

name: Sport for All Training Course will be held in Macau, China.
text:
The 4th ASFAA Sport for All Training Course will be held in Macau, China.\xa0

The theme of this year is “Sports for All and Quality of Life of Citizens” – The course is designed to provide a structural and practical training to personnel involved or about to engage in the field of Sport for All. Participants that successfully complete the course will receive a certificate from ASFAA. Participants are required to have a good command of English as this is the official course language. Simultaneous translation in English and Mandarin will be available in all training sessions.

For more details, please check the dedicated website at:

http://sport.gov.mo/en/calendary/type/item/id/6334

name: The 15th ASFAA Congress will be held during 22 to 24 Jun in Hong Kong, China
text:
Being granted the right by the Asiania Sport For All Association (ASFAA), Sports Federation & Olympic Committee (SF&OC) will spearhead this 15th ASFAA Congress to be hosted in Hong Kong.\xa0

This is the 1st time ASFAA hold its Congress in Hong Kong. Participants will explore the latest perspectives on “Sport for All” to expand participants’ horizons; and how we can better promote a sporting culture in HK / Asia and Oceania region through Olympics Education. We believe people living in Hong Kong and similar hustle bustle cities would benefit much from it.\xa0

For more details, please check the dedicated website at:

http://asfaacongress.hkolympic.org/englishwelcomepage

name: The 15th ASFAA Congress Hong Kong
text:
The 15th ASFAA Congress Hong Kong will be conducted during 22 to 24 June. For more details, please check the dedicated website at:

http://asfaacongress.hkolympic.org/englishwelcomepage

name: The 15th Asiania Sport for All Association (ASFAA) Congress ‘Achieving “Sport for All” through Olympic Education’
text:
The 15th ASFAA Congress, organized by the Asiania Sport for All Association and hosted by the Sports Federation & Olympic Committee of Hong Kong, China (SF&OC) was held on 22-24 June 2018 at the Lecture Theatre of Olympic House of Hong Kong. The Congress successfully attracted over 200 participants which include more than 60 overseas guests and 160 local participants.\xa0

The 15th ASFAA Congress aims to expand participants’ horizons and better promote a sporting culture in Hong Kong and the Asian & Oceania region through Olympic Education. Like-minded people coming from over 20 countries / cities gathered together in the Lecture Theatre of the Olympic House to attend the Opening Ceremony officiated by: Mr. PUN Weng Kun, President of Asiania Sport For All Association (ASFAA) ; Mr. Timothy FOK, GBS, JP, President of Sports Federation & Olympic Committee of HK, China; Dr. Juho CHANG, President of The Association For International Sport for All (TAFISA); Ms. Ida LEE, JP, Acting Director of Leisure and Cultural Services Department; Mr. YEUNG Tak Keung, JP, Commissioner for Sport of Home Affairs Bureau; Mr. MA Fung Kwok, SBS, JP, Legislative Councillor; Mr. Ronnie WONG, JP, Hon. Secretary General of SF&OC; and Mr. WONG Po Kee, MH, Chairperson of the 15th ASFAA Congress Organizing Committee.

The Congress invited six prominent Speakers and all of them had delivered their speeches in the 2-day Congress. The Speakers were namely, Mr. Wolfgang BAUMANN (Secretary General of TAFISA) ; Professor REN Hai (Professor, Beijing Sports University, China) ; Mr. Finn BERGGREN (President of Gerlev PE & Sports Academy, Denmark) ; Professor Yasuo YAMAGUCHI (Professor, Kobe University, Japan) ; Mrs. Rakafet ARIELI (Clinical and Sport Dietitian, Sports Medicine Centre, Israel) ; and Professor Keith GEORGE (Professor, Liverpool John Moores University, UK).

Other than spreading wisdoms and delivering speeches, the Congress also arranged attractive booths and amazing sport demonstrations for participants, including rope skipping and uni-cycle performances.

name: The 44th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting - Hong Kong, China
text:
On the occasion of the 15th ASFAA Congress in Hong Kong, China, the 44th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting was held in the afternoon on 22 June 2018.

The meeting approved the minutes of 43rd ASFAA Board Meeting, activity report and financial report of 2017, activity plan and budget of 2018; and went through the report of the 15th ASFAA Congress, Hong Kong 2018 and the 26th TAFISA World Congress, Tokyo 2019; and also finalized the host for the 16th ASFAA Congress 2020.

name: The 24th ASFAA General Assembly - Hong Kong, China
text:
The 24th ASFAA General Assembly was held in the afternoon on 23 June Hong Kong, China, with attendants coming from Indonesia, Iran, Israel, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Chinese Taipei, India, China, Macao and Hong Kong, and approving activity reports and financial reports of Year 2016 and 2017, and activity plan and budget of Year 2018.\xa0

In addition, a unanimous decision was made for China to host the 16th ASFAA Congress.

name: ASFAA hosts Sport for All Training Course
text:
The 4th ASFAA Sport for All Training Course, authorized by the Asiania Sport For All Association and hosted by the Sports Bureau of the Macao SAR Government, was held at the ASFAA Training Centre. The training course, which lasted for 3 days, provided a platform for interactions among the local and foreign individuals working on sports for all activities, so as to deepen the learners' knowledge of the current development of sport for all activities in the Asia-Pacific and European regions.

The theme of this course was “Sports for All and Quality of Life of Citizens”. Experts, scholars and learners from the mainland, Portugal, Germany, Japan, Iran, South Korea, Hong Kong and Macao took part in it. The Award Ceremony of Certificate and Gala Dinner were held in the evening of the 23 October. The President of the Sports Bureau and the President of the AASFA, Pun Weng Kun, the President of TAFISA and the Honorary President of the ASFAA, Ju-Ho Chang and members of the ASFAA board of directors and members of the Macao Sports Committee were among the guests attending the dinner.

name: The 43rd ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting - Macao, China
text:
On the occasion of the 4th ASFAA Sport for All Training Course in Macao, China, the 43rd ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting was held in the afternoon on 21 October 2017.

A number of reports on the association's affairs were approved in the meeting that helps to strengthen the communication between members of the Board of Directors, and development direction, future plans and strategies in promoting the development of Sport for All in the Asian and Oceania Region were further discussed.

name: The 47th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting - Macao, China
text:
The 47th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting was concluded on 19 Oct 2019 in Macao, China. The meeting followed up the affairs of ASFAA, continued to strengthen the communication between members of the Board of Directors, discuss the development direction, future plans and strategies to promote the development of Sport for All in the Asian and Oceania Region.

\r\n\r\n

The board members also visited “Macao Sport Festival” to learn more about the development of sport for all in Macao during the meeting.

name: The 46th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting – Ulsan, Korea
text:
The 46th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting was concluded on 21 March 2019 in Ulsan, Korea. The meeting was chaired by ASFAA President, Mr. Pun, and discussed the activities and development plans of Sport for All in the Asian and Oceania Region with board of directors from Malaysia, Israel, China, Iran, Japan, Korea and Hong Kong, China.

Several major decisions, which might bring positive influence for future Asian Sport for All, were made in the meeting. TAFISA-Korea was determined to be a host of 2020 ASFAA Congress.

By this chance, the ASFAA board members also witnessed the launching ceremony of TAFISA-Korea Secretariat and visited a sport for all workshop organized by TAFISA-Korea.

name: 46th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting, Ulsan, Korea
text: The 46th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting will be held in Ulsan, Korea on\xa021 March 2019.

name: The 45th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting – Suzhou, China
text:
On the occasion of the Global Active Cities Forum in Suzhou, China, the 45th ASFAA Board of Directors Meeting was held in the afternoon on 22 Nov 2018.\xa0

The meeting followed up the affairs of ASFAA, continued to strengthen the communication between members of the Board of Directors, discuss the development direction, future plans and strategies to promote the development of Sport for All in the Asian and Oceania Region.

name: Global Active City Forum - Suzhou, China
text:
TAFISA, the Chinese General Sport Administration and the Active Well-being Initiative have partnered to organise the first-ever national Global Active City Forum in Suzhou, China, on November 22 – 24, 2018.

The event, which was also the opportunity for the TAFISA and ASFAA Board of Directors to hold their annual meetings, gathered more than 150 participants from all over the world and 30 Chinese cities.

The presence of Chinese dignitaries sent a strong signal to the world documenting the will of China to develop Active Cities for the benefits of its citizens. Their commitment was highlighted through the Suzhou Declaration that was adopted during the closing ceremony.

The Forum served as a platform for Chinese and invited cities to exchange views and interesting approaches on how to make their citizens more active. Other high-level speakers contributed to the debate with their experiences from various parts of the globe.

name: UIA Associations Round Table Asia-Pacific 2018 - Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
text:
Hosted by Malaysia Convention & Exhibition Bureau –MyCEB, the UIA Associations Round Table Asia-Pacific 2018 took place at the Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre, Kuala Lumpur (KLCC) during 26-27 of September.

The UIA Round Table provided an opportunity to learn through networking and through practice, to meet other international associations and share experience and knowledge to improve organizational management.

Dato’ Sarjit, Vice President of ASFAA had attended the Conference.
